greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) = number of parts of size k in the last section of the set of partitions of n.
comment: It appears that in the column k, starting in row n, the sum of k successive terms is equal to A000041(n-1).
formula: It appears that A000041(n) = Sum_{j=1..k) T(n+j,k), n >= 0, k >= 1.
example: For n = 7, from the conjecture we have that p(n-1) = p(6) = 11 = 3+8 = 2+3+6 = 1+3+2+5 = 1+1+2+3+4 = 0+1+1+2+2+5, etc. where p(n) = A000041(n).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 04 2012
